If you are flying VFR above 3,000' AGL and your magnetic **course** is 0˚-179˚: You should fly at an altitude of **ODD** thousand +500' (e.g. 3,500', 5,500')

If you are flying VFR above 3,000' AGL and your magnetic **course** is 180˚-359˚: You should fly at an altitude of **EVEN** thousand +500' (e.g. 4,500', 6,500')

(14 CFR §91.159)
question: Describe appropriate VFR cruising altitudes.
